job_tasks.phrase: Design and implement scalable, maintainable features that will shape the long-term trajectory of our EdTech products.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes core software engineering activities focused on building and scaling product features, aligning with the definition of traditional software development.

job_tasks.phrase: Leverage cutting-edge AI technologies to create unprecedented learning experiences, pushing the boundaries of what's possible in education.
job_tasks.justification: The emphasis is on using AI as a tool to create product features and innovate within the educational domain, indicating integration into software rather than core AI model development.

job_tasks.phrase: Make high-stakes technical decisions that directly impact user experiences and product scalability
job_tasks.justification: This refers to making critical technical decisions related to product development, user experience, and system scalability, which are fundamental software engineering responsibilities.

job_tasks.phrase: Monitor and maintain product stability, fine-tune performance, and proactively identify and resolve issues
job_tasks.justification: These are operational aspects of ensuring the quality, reliability, and performance of the software product, falling under the broader scope of software development and maintenance.

job_tasks.phrase: Drive the technical evolution of our AI-powered EdTech products, ensuring they are scalable, innovative, and capable of delivering transformative learning experiences
job_tasks.justification: This describes the overall responsibility for the technical direction and development of products that are enhanced by AI, focusing on the engineering aspects of scalability and innovation.

soft_skills.justification: Autonomy implies taking initiative and ownership of one's work and technical direction.
This indicates the need to understand and contribute to the broader business and product strategy.

soft_skills.phrase: pushing the boundaries of what's possible in education
soft_skills.justification: This phrase highlights a drive for innovation and exploring new possibilities within the domain.

soft_skills.phrase: you'll be at the helm of their technical evolution
soft_skills.justification: This signifies taking leadership and ownership of the technical direction and development of the products.
This explicitly mentions the need for collaboration with other teams to align technical work with product goals.
This describes a proactive approach to problem-solving and ensuring product quality.

soft_skills.phrase: your expertise will be valued, and your voice will be heard
soft_skills.justification: This emphasizes the importance of communication and having one's input considered within the team and product development process.

profile.rationale: The job title is 'Senior Software Engineer' and the responsibilities are overwhelmingly focused on designing, implementing, scaling, and maintaining software products. While these products are 'AI-powered' and leverage 'cutting-edge AI technologies,' the job description does not detail any tasks related to building, fine-tuning, or directly managing AI models themselves (which would fall under Macro-Category B). The engineer's role is to build the software system that uses AI, creating an 'AI-powered feature or system.' This aligns perfectly with the definition of AI-Adjacent Software Engineer: 'Tasks are predominantly from Macro-Category A. The role builds or maintains software that directly uses or supports AI/ML models as a core part of its functionality. The output of their work is an AI-powered feature or system.'

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is exceptionally clear about the nature of the role being software engineering focused, with AI being a component of the product rather than the core deliverable of the engineer. The lack of specific AI model development tasks makes the classification straightforward and unambiguous.
